definition: theatrical work (play, opera, TV series etc)/dramatic (change, increase etc)/acute/severe

sentences.english: "The Nutcracker" is one of the most popular ballets in the world.
sentences.chinese: “胡桃夹子”是世界上最著名的芭蕾舞剧之一。

sentences.english: And so she saw this cabaret thing, and she signed us up.
sentences.chinese: 她知道了歌舞剧的事并帮我报了名。

sentences.english: Who wrote the ballet Swan Lake?
sentences.chinese: 芭蕾舞剧《天鹅湖》是谁写的？

sentences.english: He performed in long and complex ballets.
sentences.chinese: 他的表现在漫长而复杂的芭蕾舞剧。

sentences.english: I majored in classical voice and art and minored in dance and drama.
sentences.chinese: 我主修古典声乐和艺术，辅修舞蹈和舞剧。

sentences.english: But others praised the ballet for its music.
sentences.chinese: 但也有人赞扬了它的音乐舞剧。

sentences.english: The ballet is based on this version by Dumas.
sentences.chinese: 而该芭蕾舞剧使用的就是大仲马改编的版本。

sentences.english: I have two ballet tickets for tomorrow evening. You can have one.
sentences.chinese: 我有两张明晚芭蕾舞剧的票，给你一张。
笛洛娃夫人的国际芭蕾舞剧团。

sentences.english: The dance drama Bai Lu Yuan was an outstanding work in China in the present age.
sentences.chinese: 舞剧《白鹿原》是我国当代一部优秀的艺术作品。

sentences.english: The author also pondered over children dance dramas composed by Li Jinhui from the aspect of "aesthetic education".
sentences.chinese: 并对黎锦晖的儿歌舞剧，重新予以“美育”观照。

sentences.english: Today, I was at the local theatre watching "The Nutcracker" ballet with my mother.
sentences.chinese: 今天我跟妈妈在剧院看芭蕾舞剧胡桃夹子。

sentences.english: Rodgers and Hammerstein collaborated on many Broadway musicals.
The room was decorated with pictures of vaudeville celebrities.
sentences.chinese: 这个房间有轻歌舞剧明星的照片装饰。

sentences.english: Ballet, Red women's detachment is based on the film with the same name.
sentences.chinese: 芭蕾舞剧《红色娘子军》是根据同名电影改编而成。

sentences.english: Broadway in New York is the center of American modern musicals and operas.
sentences.chinese: 纽约的百老汇是美国现代歌舞剧的中心。

definition: maiden stage role/first performance/first public showing
to act (in a play)/to perform/to put on (a performance)/performance/concert/show/CL:場|场[chang3],次[ci4]
to perform (e.g. on the stage)/to lecture
The White Haired Girl (1950), one of the first PRC films
